meanings.definition: An expression of indifference or lack of enthusiasm.
meanings.sent1: When asked if he wanted to go to the party, he just shrugged and said 'meh'.
meanings.sent2: Her response to the movie was a simple 'meh', showing her lack of interest.
meanings.sent3: The cat's 'meh' when presented with a new toy was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The 'meh' from the audience after the performance was deafening.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's 'meh' at the student's excuse was a clear sign of disappointment.

meanings.sent1: The restaurant received a 'meh' review from the food critic.
meanings.sent2: The movie was just 'meh', not really worth watching again.
meanings.sent3: His attempt at a joke was met with a 'meh' from the audience.
meanings.sent4: The painting's colors were so 'meh' that it failed to capture anyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The party decorations were quite 'meh', lacking any creativity or flair.

meanings.sent1: She 'mehed' at the idea of going out in the rain.
meanings.sent2: He always 'mehs' when asked to do chores around the house.
meanings.sent3: The student 'mehed' at the thought of studying for the test.
meanings.sent4: The team 'mehed' their way through the game, showing no passion.
meanings.sent5: I 'meh' every time someone suggests watching that boring movie again.
